author: Rose Cahalan
title: The Texas Coral Snake Just Wants to Be Left Alone
text: [wonderful and quirky critters](https://www.texasmonthly.com/tag/critter-of-the-month/). Latin name: Micrurus tener Size: Usually less than three feet long Texas habitat: The state‚Äôs southeastern half ‚ÄúRed touch yellow, kill a fellow. Red touch black, friend of Jack.‚Äù This mnemonic aims to distinguish the coral snake, one of fifteen venomous snakes in Texas, from harmless lookalikes. But use this mostly accurate phrase at your own risk, warns Spencer Greene, director of toxicology at HCA Houston Healthcare Kingwood. Greene once treated a Boy Scout whose troop leader thought the saying went ‚ÄúRed touch yellow, friend of a fellow.‚Äù Of all venomous Texas critters, Greene says, only the black widow spider boasts a more agonizing bite. Now I‚Äôm terrified. You shouldn‚Äôt be! ‚ÄúThis is a shy snake,‚Äù says [Clint ‚ÄúThe Snake Man‚Äù Pustejovsky](https://www.texasmonthly.com/travel/houston-area-emergency-room-snake-bucket/), who educates audiences about his favorite reptile through his Houston-based outfit, Texas Snakes & More. Unlike copperheads or rattlers, coral snakes strike only when someone is reckless enough to pick them up. Of the forty or so coral snake bites Greene has treated, he recalls just two exceptions to that rule: ‚ÄúOne was a woman who stepped on it barefoot in the dark, and the other was a guy who reached into a bush.‚Äù About fifty Texans are bitten annually. While the venom causes an excruciating ‚Äúelectric sensation‚Äù that sends most victims to the hospital, it‚Äôs never fatal, he says. How likely am I to see one? Not very. These introverted critters, along with the other two coral snake species in the U.S., account for less than 1 percent of snake bites nationally. ‚ÄúCoral snakes get a bad rap for being venomous,‚Äù says Pustejovsky, ‚Äúbut they‚Äôre just trying to stay away from us.‚Äù They spend most of their lives hiding under leaves and rocks. Coral snakes eat smaller snakes, while their predators include birds, bobcats, and raccoons, says Toby Hibbitts, a herpetologist at Texas A&M University. ‚ÄúBut all those animals are susceptible to its venom, so they tend not to mess with coral snakes much.‚Äù That sounds like good advice for humans too. Exactly. And the ‚Äúred touch yellow‚Äù rhyme won‚Äôt help you in Central or South America, where coral snakes come in all kinds of colors, or if you encounter an albino or melanistic snake. A wiser mnemonic might be: ‚ÄúNo matter its hue, that snake could bite you.‚Äù What else is notable about this species? It‚Äôs the only Texas member of the Elapidae family, which also includes cobras, mambas, and other scary serpents. All Elapidae have permanently erect front fangs, and most of them (including the Texas coral snake) lay eggs instead of giving birth. A common myth holds that coral snakes also have rear fangs, but that‚Äôs not true. Nor do they chew to inject venom into their prey, as some believe. Correction: This story previously stated that Texas coral snake bites are ‚Äúalmost never fatal.‚Äù No one has ever died from a Texas coral snake bite (there was one fatality from an Eastern coral snake bite, in Florida). This version has been corrected. An abbreviated version of this article originally appeared in the August 2024 issue of Texas Monthly with the headline ‚ÄúTexas Coral Snake.‚Äù [Subscribe today](https://www.texasmonthly.com/subscribe/end-article/). - More About: [Critters](https://www.texasmonthly.com/category/critters/)

author: Diario La Tribuna
title: Una mujer es arrestada en El Salvador por supuestamente matar a su hija a golpes
text: Una mujer es arrestada en El Salvador por supuestamente matar a su hija a golpes San Salvador.- Una mujer fue arrestada en El Salvador por supuestamente golpear su hija de 5 a√±os y ocasionarle la muerte, seg√∫n inform√≥ este jueves la Polic√≠a Nacional Civil (PNC), un hecho que varias ONG internacionales lamentaron. El cuerpo policial indic√≥ que la supuesta responsable es Jacqueline Cruz Mart√≠nez, de 30 a√±os, quien habr√≠a golpeado a la ni√±a por ‚Äúno haber realizado limpieza en casa‚Äù. La Polic√≠a a√±adi√≥ que Cruz Mart√≠nez ser√° ‚Äúprocesada por este crimen‚Äù, del que no se brindaron m√°s detalles ni se especific√≥ en qu√© zona del pa√≠s ocurri√≥. Organizaciones no gubernamentales que velan por el bienestar y los derechos de los ni√±os y adolescentes salvadore√±os expresaron el mi√©rcoles su preocupaci√≥n por los ‚Äúlamentables casos de homicidios y agresiones a reci√©n nacidos registrados en las √∫ltimas semanas‚Äù en el pa√≠s. Las ONG, entre estas Plan Internacional, Educo y Save The Children y que son parte de la Alianza Joining Forces, reiteraron su compromiso para ‚Äúunir fuerzas y promover en conjunto con el Estado, la familia y las comunidades, programas para prevenir toda forma de violencia contra la infancia, ni√±ez y adolescencia‚Äù. Seg√∫n ha reportado la prensa local, en lo que va de 2024 al menos 7 reci√©n nacidos han sido v√≠ctimas de homicidio o maltrato, esto de acuerdo con la Polic√≠a. La corporaci√≥n policial recientemente inform√≥ que un reci√©n nacido hab√≠a sido rescatado con vida luego de ser localizado en la letrina de una vivienda, en una zona rural del municipio de Izalco (este). La Alianza Joining Forces tambi√©n recomienda al Estado salvadore√±o ‚Äúdivulgar acciones y alternativas apegadas al marco normativo y legal con las que se cuentan para priorizar en todo momento la protecci√≥n integral de las madres y la de sus beb√©s‚Äù. EFE üö® CAPTURAN A PADRES QUE ASESINARON A SU HIJA La Polic√≠a Nacional Civil present√≥ a: Jacqueline Cruz Mart√≠nez, de 30 a√±os de edad, y a Carlos Francisco Sasa P√©rez de 29 a√±os. Responsables del asesinato de su hija de 5 a√±os. El delito fue cometido esta ma√±ana en El Proyecto Santa‚Ä¶ [pic.twitter.com/9TGd4MVH45] ‚Äî Mr Elegante ‚ú™ (@MrElegantesv) [April 25, 2024]

author: Reda√ß√£o
title: Dra. Luciana de Abreu revoluciona a dermatologia com abordagem humanizada e compromisso com a sa√∫de da pele
text: Dermatologista se destaca na Barra da Tijuca com dedica√ß√£o ao bem-estar e √† autoestima de cada paciente A trajet√≥ria da Luciana de Abreu √© constru√≠da com dedica√ß√£o e cuidado. Fundadora da Cl√≠nica Luciana de Abreu Dermatologia, na Barra da Tijuca, Rio de Janeiro, tornou-se refer√™ncia por sua abordagem que integra sa√∫de e est√©tica, devolvendo aos pacientes a confian√ßa e a seguran√ßa em suas pr√≥prias peles. H√° 11 anos, fundou sua pr√≥pria cl√≠nica, um espa√ßo que ampliou h√° tr√™s anos para oferecer mais conforto e tecnologia aos pacientes. Esse ambiente, cuidadosamente planejado, representa sua vis√£o de um atendimento que vai al√©m da t√©cnica e valoriza o indiv√≠duo. Uma de suas marcas registradas √© a consulta inicial, onde realiza uma avalia√ß√£o completa e minuciosa da pele, analisando n√£o s√≥ a est√©tica, mas tamb√©m a sa√∫de de forma integral. Ela avalia tanto o rosto quanto o corpo do paciente, oferecendo tratamentos faciais e corporais, incluindo op√ß√µes para o rejuvenescimento do corpo. Com a ajuda de uma c√¢mera 3D, permite que o paciente veja a pr√≥pria pele com mais profundidade, identificando detalhes e compreendendo as orienta√ß√µes de forma objetiva. "Cuidar da pele √© muito mais do que est√©tica. Na primeira consulta, fa√ßo uma an√°lise completa para garantir que a sa√∫de do paciente est√° em dia,"explica. Esse primeiro contato, que pode durar at√© uma hora, √© essencial para estabelecer um relacionamento de confian√ßa e alinhar as expectativas. Um dos pontos altos de sua carreira foi sua pesquisa sobre melasma, uma condi√ß√£o de pele frequente no Brasil que afeta principalmente as mulheres e impacta diretamente a autoestima. Durante o mestrado na Universidade Federal do Rio de Janeiro (UFRJ), investigou as camadas da pele onde as manchas de melasma se concentram, realizando bi√≥psias e an√°lises celulares detalhadas para entender a profundidade desse pigmento. "O melasma √© desafiador, mas entendo que parte do meu papel √© trazer al√≠vio, ajudando essas mulheres no controle e clareamento das manchas para reconquistarem sua confian√ßa," afirma. Essa pesquisa, al√©m de avan√ßar o conhecimento na √°rea, fortaleceu sua conex√£o com as necessidades emocionais das pacientes, que encontram nela n√£o s√≥ uma m√©dica, mas uma aliada em suas batalhas de autoestima. Al√©m de dermatologista, Luciana √© uma professora dedicada, comprometida em compartilhar seu conhecimento e experi√™ncia com a nova gera√ß√£o de m√©dicos. Por anos, atuou como preceptora na Santa Casa da Miseric√≥rdia do Rio de Janeiro, onde orientou e inspirou in√∫meros residentes. Atualmente, dedica-se ao ensino em sua cl√≠nica, onde ministra cursos hands on de preenchimento facial para m√©dicos que desejam aprimorar suas t√©cnicas. "O ensino √© uma extens√£o do que acredito ser minha miss√£o. Compartilhar conhecimento √© plantar uma semente para o futuro da dermatologia,"reflete. Ela ensina com uma abordagem pr√°tica e generosa, dividindo com entusiasmo cada t√©cnica e detalhe que adquiriu ao longo dos anos. Sua filosofia √© clara: formar profissionais que perpetuem sua vis√£o de beleza natural e respeito √† sa√∫de √© uma maneira de expandir o impacto positivo que busca em sua pr√°tica. Em sua cl√≠nica, ela criou um n√∫cleo de tecnologias avan√ßadas, que re√∫ne as mais consagradas do mercado para tratar pele, gordura e m√∫sculo.Entre os tratamentos, utiliza tecnologias de ponta como ultrassom microfocado, v√°rios tipos de laseres e procedimentos para redu√ß√£o de gordura e celulite, sempre avaliando tanto tratamentos faciais quanto corporais. Cada tecnologia √© escolhida com base em estudos e testes feitos pela pr√≥pria Dra. Luciana para garantir benef√≠cios reais e duradouros. "Eu busco sempre o que pode agregar ao paciente de forma duradoura e natural, sem recorrer a modismos,"explica. Sua abordagem, voltada para a naturalidade e eleg√¢ncia, atrai um p√∫blico que valoriza uma est√©tica atemporal, em que os procedimentos s√£o sutis e respeitam a beleza √∫nica de cada indiv√≠duo. A consulta inicial √© mais do que uma an√°lise t√©cnica; √© o primeiro passo para criar uma conex√£o verdadeira e oferecer acolhimento e suporte ao paciente, que muitas vezes busca n√£o apenas tratamentos, mas uma jornada de bem-estar e autoestima.Esse acompanhamento √© cont√≠nuo: Dra. Luciana faz quest√£o de seguir cada paciente ao longo dos anos, testemunhando seu envelhecimento de maneira saud√°vel e natural. "Tenho pacientes que se tornam amigos, pois acompanho v√°rias fases de suas vidas e fico feliz em v√™-los envelhecendo bem, sentindo-se cada vez melhor com o passar dos anos,"comenta. Para o futuro, ela planeja expandir os m√≥dulos de seus cursos, abrangendo temas como tecnologias para tratamentos corporais e bioestimuladores, reafirmando sua posi√ß√£o como refer√™ncia em dermatologia humanizada. Ela tamb√©m deseja seguir aprimorando os servi√ßos da cl√≠nica, ampliando o cuidado integral e personalizado que oferece. Mais do que transformar a apar√™ncia, ela v√™ seu trabalho como um resgate da autoestima. "Quando voc√™ se sente bem, isso reflete em todas as √°reas da vida. Se olhar no espelho e gostar do que v√™ √© uma for√ßa transformadora,"diz. Em cada paciente, enxerga mais do que uma pele a ser tratada: v√™ uma hist√≥ria e um ser humano em busca de sa√∫de, bem-estar e realiza√ß√£o pessoal. Para ela, a miss√£o da dermatologia √© auxiliar nesse reencontro do paciente com sua melhor vers√£o. "Se algu√©m est√° insatisfeito, seja com a apar√™ncia ou com a autoestima, √© importante que busque ajuda para se sentir bem consigo mesmo. Quando nos sentimos bem, isso muda tudo ao nosso redor para melhor,"finaliza. SAIBA MAIS: Site: https://www.lucianadeabreu.com.br Instagram: @dralucianadeabreu

author: Ryan Dunne
title: Munster abuse trial: Sentences imposed on family members too lenient, State argues ‚Äì The Irish Times
text: The State has argued that sentences of between nine and 15 years that were imposed on three family members jailed as part of the Munster abuse trial, in what was described by a judge as a case of ‚Äúsheer horror‚Äù featuring the rape and sexual exploitation of young children, were too lenient. ‚ÄúYou can in some cases consider life in prison, and that is how bad this case was,‚Äù said counsel for the State Bernard Condon SC, bringing the appeals before the Court of Appeal on Thursday on behalf of the Director of Public Prosecutions. The victims‚Äô father (59) was convicted of rape, sexual exploitation, sexual assault, and child cruelty, and was sentenced to 15 years in prison by Mr Justice Paul McDermott at the Central Criminal Court in January 2022. Their mother (37) was convicted of sexual assault, sexual exploitation, and child cruelty, and was sentenced to nine years in prison. And their uncle (51) was convicted of rape, sexual assault, and sexual exploitation, and was sentenced to 15 years in prison. The offences occurred between August 2014 and April 2016, starting when three of the victims ‚Äì a young girl and her two brothers ‚Äì were aged five, six and seven. [European Election: Mick Wallace loses out as Kathleen Funchion (SF), Michael McNamara (Ind) and Cynthia N√≠ Mhurch√∫ (FF) win final seats in Ireland South](/politics/2024/06/13/european-election-results-midlands-north-west-ireland-south-counts-live/) Reporting restrictions put in place by the trial judge, preventing the publication of the exact nature of the abuse the children suffered to protect their welfare and identities, remain in place. Mr Condon referenced the ‚Äúastonishing features‚Äù of the case, saying that a headline sentence of 16 years had been set in the case of the victims‚Äô father and uncle respectively, but the sentencing court ought to have considered this offending at the top level of seriousness. Concerning the offences inflicted on the children for years, which had a catastrophic effect on them, Mr Condon said that there was ‚Äúbarely a feature of aggravation that is missing‚Äù from this case. The court heard that the children have since been taken into care by the State. Ms Justice Isobel Kennedy said that as this case involved multiple offences of a sexual nature, there would be very little mitigation even when the respondent had no previous convictions. In the case of the victims‚Äô uncle, Mr Condon said that the man was ‚Äúa central player in the abuse‚Äù, who raped two of the children and sexually abused all three. Concerning the mother of the victims, Mr Condon said that a headline sentence of 12 years had been set, but there was then a reduction of 25 per cent for mitigation, which the State said was excessive. Mr Condon said that the trial judge had considered that for the sexual assaults she committed, the starting point for sentencing should be the same as her husband, but the judge had gone on to say that the dynamic in the offending had not been driven by her. Mr Condon said that all aggravating features were present in the mother‚Äôs case. He said that her involvement was at the top end of the scale, not the middle, so a 12-year headline sentence was too low. Mr Justice John Edwards noted that she had no previous convictions and had led a very difficult early life, which featured a lot of physical chastisement, so there was some mitigation there. Mark Nicholas SC, defence counsel for the father, said that this was a serious case, but the trial judge, having listened to the evidence, quite correctly set the right zone for the headline sentence. He said there was no suggestion of any offending by the father up to 2014, while a lengthy prison sentence would affect the father greater than it would a younger man. Defence counsel for the uncle, Andrew Sexton SC, said that the trial judge had indicated that the sentence imposed reflected the seriousness of the offences, as he had addressed the matter carefully and methodically before coming to his conclusion. [ [Child victim in Munster abuse case says his parents should go to jail ‚Äòfor a long time‚Äô](https://www.irishtimes.com/news/crime-and-law/courts/criminal-court/child-victim-in-munster-abuse-case-says-his-parents-should-go-to-jail-for-a-long-time-1.4773180) ] While the trial judge had set a headline sentence of 16 years, Mr Sexton said that the judge had also imposed probation supervision for three years, which was a feature of the overall sentence. Pointing out that the offending occurred over not quite two years, Mr Sexton said that there was not a litany of violent behaviour in this case, to which Mr Justice Edwards said that ‚Äúrape is an inherently violent act‚Äù. Mr Sexton said that his client had led a blameless life up to that point, and he had a history of ill health, although counsel accepted that there was limited evidence of that. Dean Kelly SC, defending the mother, said that the judge who heard the case was by some distance the most experienced trial judge in the State, and the dynamic of the offending had not been driven by the victims‚Äô mother. Mr Justice Edwards noted the ‚Äúsheer horror‚Äù of this case, while Ms Justice Kennedy said that there had been ‚Äúa gross breach of trust‚Äù. Mr Justice Edwards said that the court would reserve judgment in the case. - Sign up for [push alerts](https://www.irishtimes.com/media/2023/11/07/stay-informed-with-push-alerts-from-the-irish-times-delivered-straight-to-your-phone/)and have the best news, analysis and comment delivered directly to your phone - Join [The Irish Times on WhatsApp](https://www.irishtimes.com/media/2023/10/27/find-the-irish-times-on-whatsapp-and-stay-up-to-date/)and stay up to date - Listen to our [Inside Politics podcast](https://www.irishtimes.com/podcasts/inside-politics/)for the best political chat and analysis

author: visao.sapo.pt
title: Hortas Pedag√≥gicas Biol√≥gicas j√° deram ‚Äúfrutos‚Äù | Not√≠cias de Vila Real
text:
In√≠cio Not√≠cias Hortas Pedag√≥gicas Biol√≥gicas j√° deram ‚Äúfrutos‚Äù Not√≠cias Hortas Pedag√≥gicas Biol√≥gicas j√° deram ‚Äúfrutos‚Äù Por NVR - 5 de Julho, 2024 Facebook Twitter WhatsApp Email As Hortas Pedag√≥gicas Biol√≥gicas das escolas dos concelhos de Boticas, Chaves, Ribeira de Pena, Valpa√ßos e Vila Pouca de Aguiar, inauguradas no passado m√™s de abril, j√° colheram a produ√ß√£o resultante do seu cultivo.
Cebola, batata, couve, alface, feij√£o, courgette, tomate, morangos e arom√°ticas foram alguns dos produtos cultivados nestas hortas e que agora foram colhidos. A atividade da colheita foi aproveitada para torn√°-la em mais um momento de consciencializa√ß√£o dos mais novos para a produ√ß√£o e consumo de alimentos saud√°veis, bem como para a pr√°tica de atividades de cariz social, uma vez que, para al√©m da op√ß√£o da confe√ß√£o dos alimentos na cantina escolar, foram tamb√©m elaborados cabazes para entrega a institui√ß√µes de solidariedade social.
De recordar que este projeto nasceu da articula√ß√£o entre a Comunidade Intermunicipal do Alto T√¢mega e Barroso (CIMAT) e os Munic√≠pios do territ√≥rio, no √¢mbito da Bio Regi√£o do Alto T√¢mega e Barroso, e tem como objetivo a promo√ß√£o de uma alimenta√ß√£o mais saud√°vel e, ao mesmo tempo, mais sustent√°vel, n√£o s√≥ dentro destes estabelecimentos de ensino, mas tamb√©m em casa, uma vez que as crian√ßas e adolescentes t√™m um papel fundamental na influ√™ncia das compras e da alimenta√ß√£o feita nos seus lares, sendo estes os melhores passa-a-palavra aos adultos, n√£o esquecendo que estes ser√£o tamb√©m os consumidores de amanh√£.
Artigo anterior Bela Alice e Alina Vaz concorrem √† lideran√ßa do PSD Vila Real NVR
